description: Azure monitor dashboard for Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server health including server health, resource usage (cpu, memory, iops, storage), connections, throughput, latency etc.

options.content:
PostgreSQL Name: ${resource} Endpoint: ${endpoint}
Resource Group: ${rg} Version: ${version}
Status: ${status} Compute Size: ${computesize}
Location: ${location} Storage Size (GB): ${storagesize}

panels.description: Indicates if the database is up or not
panels.title: DB Uptime

panels.description: Percentage of CPU in use
panels.title: CPU Usage (Avg)

panels.description: Percentage of memory in use
panels.title: Memory Usage (Avg)

panels.description: Percent of storage space that's used. The storage that's used by the service can include database files, transaction logs, and server logs
panels.title: Storage Usage Percent (Avg)

panels.description: Used and Free storage. The storage that's used by the service can include the database files, transaction logs, and the server logs.
panels.title: Storage

panels.description: Bytes read per second from disk
panels.title: Slow Queries

panels.description: The storage you provision is the amount of storage capacity available to your Azure Database for PostgreSQL server. The storage is used for the database files, temporary files, transaction logs, and the PostgreSQL server logs
panels.title: Data Storage Used

panels.description: Amount of storage space that's used by the transaction logs
panels.title: BinLog Storage Used

panels.description: Amount of storage space that's used by the transaction logs
panels.title: Ibdata1 Storage Used

panels.description: Amount of storage space that's used by the transaction logs
panels.title: Other Storage Used

panels.description: Amount of incoming network traffic
panels.title: Threads Running

panels.description: Number of connections to your server
panels.title: Active Connections

panels.description: Number of succeeded connections
panels.title: Aborted Connections

panels.description: Number of total transactions executed in this database.
panels.title: Active Transactions

panels.description: Bytes written to disk per second
panels.title: MySQL Lock Deadlocks

panels.description: Number of connections to your server
panels.title: HA SQL Status

panels.description: Number of connections to your server
panels.title: HA IO Status

panels.description: Amount of incoming network traffic
panels.title: Network In

panels.description: Amount of outgoing network traffic
panels.title: Network Out

panels.description: Percentage of CPU in use
panels.title: CPU / Memory

panels.description: Number of transactions executed within a second.
panels.title: Active Transactions

panels.description: Amount of storage space that's available
panels.title: Storage Used Percent

panels.description: Amount of storage space that's used. The storage that's used by the service can include the database files, transaction logs, and the server logs
panels.title: Storage Used (Bytes)

panels.description: Amount of storage space that's used by the transaction logs
panels.title: Binlog Storage Used

panels.description: Number of active, failed and succeeded connections to your server.
panels.title: Server Connections

panels.description: Amount of backup storage used. This metric represents the sum of storage that's consumed by all the full backups, differential backups, and log backups that are retained based on the backup retention period that's set for the server. The frequency of the backups is service managed. For geo-redundant storage, backup storage usage is twice the usage for locally redundant storage
panels.title: Backup Storage Used (last 30 days)

azureResourceGraph.query:
Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.dbformysql/flexibleservers'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project location

Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.dbformysql/flexibleservers'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project tostring(properties.state)

Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.dbformysql/flexibleservers'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project tostring(sku.name)

Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.dbformysql/flexibleservers'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project tostring(properties.fullyQualifiedDomainName)

Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.dbformysql/flexibleservers'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project tostring(properties.version)

Resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.dbformysql/flexibleservers'
| where name == '${resource}'
| project properties.storage.storageSizeGB

title: Azure MySQL
